channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VT

item.title: Report X-2023060926
item.description:
Report X-2023060926

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T18:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the end of our IC/Tuggers conveyor belt, where it was discovered that the package was leaking. Package was pulled off the conveyor belt and put into a red HazMat bin, in a safe manner. DescribePack: Unsure if it was due to the cap on one of the bottles not being tightened, but it seemed to be leaking from the top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contained in a safety bin, and area where the spill occurred was cleaned with absorbent pads and water.

item.title: Report X-2023060664
item.description:
Report X-2023060664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T18:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-29
  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a trailer on door, where it was discovered that there was a leaking Hazmat on the trailer. Box was safely pulled from said trailer and safely put in a Hazmat bin. Upon further investigation, it was determined that the Hazmat was placed in a wall of packages, higher than it should be. This might have contributed to the failure of the package. DescribePack: Leaking around the body of the drum, unsure exactly where, but does not seem to be from closure or top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Safely placed in a Red Hazmat Bin, where it was brought to the QA Hazmat area.

item.title: Report X-2023050892
item.description:
Report X-2023050892

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T18:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: WILLISTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Heavyweight area of our ramp location in Williston VT received a pallet with it's contents wrapped in black opaque shrink wrap. When package was about to be loaded to be delivered, an employee noticed the shrink wrap was ripped in a corner and a drum under the shrink wrap was marked and labeled as a class 9 Environmentally Hazardous UN 2077. Inspection of the contents found several drums all marked and labeled for travel as a regulated dangerous good, however, dangerous goods paperwork was not offered with this pack nor were the labels duplicated on the outer most package. it is possible package originated in Germany and was offered to FedEx via DHL Supply chain, however, this can not be substantiated. Package has been held at station pending FAA investigation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the scene when package was discovered to be leaking, before being loaded into a delivery van. Package was pulled to the side and safely contained in a hazmat bin and brought to the QA Cage. DescribePack: many of the cans were bent, but one was found to be leaking from the bottom corner, which is the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contained in a hazmat bin, brought to the QA Cage

item.title: Report E-2023030778
item.description:
Report E-2023030778

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-11T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: ROCKINGHAM
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 53ft-by-5ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-5ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that approximately thirty (30) gallons of product was released. Hepaco personnel neutralized the impacted areas and used granular absorbents to collect the material. The damaged metal drum containing approximately twenty (20) gallons of remaining product was overpacked into an 85-gallon poly drum. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

Report X-2022121082

  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING DUE TO WET SPOT ON CORNER OF BOX. STATION QA WAS NOTIFIED AND PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT BIN. DescribePack: LID ON METAL DRUM IS BULGING (HARD TO CAPTURE CLEARLY IN PHOTOS). UNCLEAR HOW THIS HAPPENED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: STATION QA WAS NOTIFIED AND PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT BIN.

item.title: Report I-2022120311
item.description:
Report I-2022120311

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-11T21:09:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-18
  • City: HARTFORD
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROSS EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Ross forklift operator was loading freight to a trailer and one drum of four drums on a wooden pallet when the forklift operator noticed liquid leaking from one of the drums to terminal concrete floor. It was determine a forklift fork speared the drum when the freight was picked up by the forklift. It was determined 55 gallons of product leaked out of the drum. The forklift operator immedicately notified a supervisor who with the dock crew reviewed what the product was and established containment of the product. The dock crew contained the spill then proceeded to safely isolate the drum and dtermining it was safe to start cleanup of the product, placing the hazadous material material in a recovery drum. The damaged drum and product was sent to NH terminal for it to be disposed of.
